content.description: Stand start matched on an undercling sidepull right at about waist height. Pull off the ground with a good right foot and a good left foot. Reel in the undercling with your right bicep and stand tall to a crimper. From here reel in the undercling a bit more and bump to a far two finger gaston. Walk your feet and figure out how to get your right hand up to a small shelf. Once here, gather up all your mustard and blue cheese and go for the bucket at the lip!    Hard and great movement!
content.location: This route is directly right of "Guilded Fleece". Or left of "Tommy's Problem".

content.description:
A super fun warm up with some neat moves. Starts on the right side of the Darkness Falls boulder.  

  Start sitting on a strange feature sticking out of the wall. Compress your way up it, find a way to stand up and get the hidden sidepull, then work your way to the top. Top it out and do it again.
content.protection: 1 pad is probably enough. A spotter if you aren't comfortable enough with being up high.
content.location: In the Movie Gallery Area (to the right from the gazebo), on the same boulder with Darkness Falls. If you're looking at Darkness Falls this is on the face on the right side of that boulder.

content.description: An eliminate that's pretty fun and a decent warm-up for your fingers. Start with left hand on a waaay low left flake and right hand up higher on a good edge (this same edge is used in Blade Runner). Find your feet and then bump your left hand to this crazy shark-tooth hold, don't try to crimp directly on the tooth or you'll cut yourself open, instead push against the back of the tooth and get a weird thumb pinch. Bump again to a good crimp right below the arete and then throw to the lip. The arete isn't used in the FA, but honestly it's not needed either as the high left crimp is really good and closer to you, it'd be a pretty big reach to use the arete.
content.location: Between Hot Rod and Blade Runner in the Movie Gallery area

content.description: Stand start about five feet left of the arete on a pair of small sharp crimps about 5 feet off the ground. Pull on and bust a hard move up to a small crimp rail before gathering your mustard and dunking the lip. There are a few intermediate gastons if you can't dunk like Lebron. once on the lip, match hands and throw it behind you! Good eye Tommy!
content.location: to the left of "The Golden Nikes"

content.description: Sit start at the base of the large vertical/ diagonal rail features. Find some feet and make a few desperate moves to gain improving holds on the vertical rails. Continue up the rails to top out on large holds.
content.protection: 3 pads, falls could be a bit funky
content.location: This problem is located just left of "Darkness Falls" and is found just outside of the cave-like feature where a few projects reside.Â

content.description:
Stand start with a good left hand hold at about five and a half feet and a pinch for the right hand slightly higher and to the right. Pull on and make a move out left to a good hold. Fire out right to a sidepull and then reach out to holds at the lip. 

  There is a sit start project that could be pretty difficult.
content.protection: Atleast 2 pads and a spotter. The landing is not good.
content.location: To the left of Darkness Falls before the drop off into the Movie Gallery.

content.description:
A fun arete with that can be climbed with a bunch of little move or a couple bigger moves.  

  Sit start down on the arete and head up to a better holds higher up on the arete, eventually hitting the lip of the boulder out right. Top it out, and jump down or down climb. Now do it again in one big jump like Rod Kimble.
content.location: In the Movie Gallery area, this climbs the short arete to the left of Blade Runner.

content.description: Smooth friendly rock makes this climb one of the best in the park. Sit start with a couple sloper sidepulls and follow the dike like features up to the sloper arete. rock over on to the slab or follow the arete up and right.
content.location: The far left of "The Golden Nikes" face. From the buoys head right for about 30 feet and look upwards towards the cliffs. This line protrudes with it's unique texture.

content.description:
A fun traverse arete that can be done in even really broken and old sneakers (like mine).  

  Sit or stand start on the arete, get your feet up onto the obvious giant foothold out right, and then traverse all the way up the arete, using toehooks if you want. Traverse the lip out left a few more moves after the arete ends so you can get to a spot for an easier top out.
content.protection: 1 pad is plenty. Landing is flat, there is a rock you may want to pad to protect your head if you blow the topout though.
content.location: In the Movie Gallery Area. On the same boulder as Hot Rod and Bladerunner, but on the side you approach the boulder from. If you're looking at Hot Rod this is the obvious arete on the other side of the boulder.

content.description: The full line is going to be a sit start, but doing the stand start comes first. Grab a small undercling crimp flake system and find a foot to oppose off of. Pull off the ground with difficulty and deadpoint to a large sharp hold out left. Keep the tension, and fire up right hand to an awkward jug. Throw the feet back on the wall and grab the jugs and topout. Sit start looks to be around v10-11.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter. The rock with Bladerunner is pretty close behind this problem.
content.location: In the Cave to the left of Darkness Falls starting on the prominent undercling flake system.

content.description:
This problem has evolved slightly over the years and the original stand start line that Troy did years ago no longer makes sense.

 Sit-start under the twin crack/seam features with a high right hand incut crimp and a left hand gaston just below. Pull on and power out left to a positive pocket-like hold before making several more difficult moves up the features in order to gain the lip of the boulder before topping out.
content.protection: Crash-pad and a Spotter. This line actually has a flat rock at its base making it a great landing.
content.location: Located about 50 yards before reaching Mammoth Rock. You will see a large blank face when looking uphill from the trail to Mammoth Rock, this problem starts around the corner and on the next boulder with the next blank face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the right arete with a hand on the giant foot platform and a hand on the arete. Get a high heel next to your hand and make a desperate move up right hand to a decent sloper on the arete. From here continue up the arete to the lip before topping out. FA was in the good'ole work boots.
content.location: Movie Gallery Area. This is the jug arete when walking towards "Darkness Falls".

content.description: This is a direct version of "Darkness Falls", which offers some excellent movement and could very well be the more natural line. Sit-start with a left hand gaston and a higher right hand on an incut crimp sidepull. Pull-on and move up lefty to ta slopey hold in the diagnol seam. From here pull out to a sidepull/ undercling pinch out right before standing tall to a sloping rail for the left hand. Once here, latch the arete and continue straight up.
content.location: In the Movie Gallery. This boulder is located behind "The Golden Nikes" and shares a start with "Darkness Falls"

content.description: Sit Sart with the left hand on a sidepull of crystals, and the right hand in a pocket formation in the crystals. pull off the ground and use small cystal crimps or make a big move up high to a rail, then a good crystal edge out left. Pull over with some slopers.
content.location: The climb is located downhill from the "Movie Gallery Area". The face is full of crystals and hard to miss. Directly right of the last orange booey.

content.description:
A short problem that can be done as an arete, or one big deadpoint/dyno.  

  Start with left hand on a knob on the left arete, and right on the right arete down low. Find some feet and maybe a heel hook and either fire for the slot (way cooler) or bump your way up the arete until you can match and finish at the top.
content.location: In the movie gallery area, if you're looking at Blade Runner, turn around and you'll see a little soda can shaped boulder, this is it.

content.description:
This problem is a crimpy traverse which then leads to a good top out. It also has one of the few decent landings that Clough has to offer.  

  There is a project that starts way inside the tunnel and then it connects to the top out of this problem. Known as the Wormhole Project.
content.protection: Two Crash pads. One is enough but Two is always better.
content.location: This problem starts inside a tunnel on the rock adjacent to Darkness Falls.

content.description:
If you like crimpers, compression and hard snags, this one may be for you.

 This problem is squeezed in between "Wolves Of Chernobyl" and "Tommy's Problem". Start low on two opposing sidepull crimps. Pull on and make a desperate right-hand latch to a sharp crimp sidepull. Stand up and throw out to a bad left-hand sidepull, then make another move or two before reaching the lip and topping out.

 The grade is unconfirmed, but it is V-hard.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads. Landing is actually good.
content.location: This is problem is on one of the main walls in the Movie Gallery. This face is visible from the buoys, and usually has chalk on it.

content.description:
This short little climb has more moves and is trickier than one would think. It was completely dark when it was done, hence the name from the Iron Maiden song.  

  Start matched in the crack, with some ok feet. Traverse to the left until you can find something good enough to top out on.  

  I'll get some pictures and update the description tomorrow, it's been a while since I've done it.
content.protection: Two pads, or 1 pad and a spotter. The landing for part of it is pretty bad.
content.location: If you are looking at Top Gun, turn around and you'll be facing a boulder with a crack in it. This climb starts in the crack and heads left.

content.description: A large cluster of decent-sized boulders. This area has something for everyone. From v1 aretes to double-digit projects, this area is bound to captivate the climbers' imagination.
